sdd

Class SddManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sdd.SddManager

  • public class SddManager
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SddManager(long varCount, boolean autoGcMin)
      Creates a new SDD manager using a balanced vtree over the given number of variables.
      SddManager(Vtree vtree)
      Creates a new SDD manager, given a vtree.

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      void free()
      Frees the memory of an SDD manager created by new sdd manager, including all SDD nodes created using that manager.
      void garbageCollect()
      Performs a global garbage collection: Claims all dead SDD nodes in the manager.
      boolean garbageCollect(float deadNodeThreshold)
      Performs a global garbage collection if the number of dead SDD nodes over the number of all SDD nodes in the manager exceeds dead node threshold.
      boolean garbageCollect(float deadNodeThreshold, Vtree vtree)
      Performs local garbage collection if the number of dead SDD nodes over the number of all SDD nodes in the vtree exceeds dead node threshold.
      void garbageCollect(Vtree vtree)
      Performs local garbage collection: Claims all dead SDD nodes inside or above vtree.

      Returns true if automatic garbage collection and automatic SDD minimization is activated, and returns false otherwise.
      boolean isVarUsed(long var)
      Returns true if var is referenced by a decision SDD node (dead or alive); returns false otherwise.
      void minimize()
      Performs global garbage collection and then tries to minimize the size of manager’s SDD.
      Vtree minimize(Vtree vtree)
      Performs local garbage collection on vtree and then tries to minimize the size of SDD of vtree by searching for a different vtree.
      void minimizeLimited()
      Performs global garbage collection and then tries to minimize the size of manager’s SDD.
      Vtree minimizeLimited(Vtree vtree)
      Performs local garbage collection on vtree and then tries to minimize the size of SDD of vtree by searching for a different vtree.
      void moveVarAfter(long var, long targetVar)
      Move the given variable after the target variable in the Vtree.
      void moveVarAfterLast(long var)
      Move the given variable after the last variable in the Vtree.

      Move the given variable before the target variable in the Vtree.

      Move the given variable before the first variable in the Vtree.

      Prints various statistics that are collected by an SDD manager.

      Saves the SDD of the manager’s vtree (a shared SDD), formatted for use with Graphviz dot.

      Sets the threshold for terminating the passes performed by the vtree search algorithm.

      Sets the absolute size limit on the size of a cartesian product for right rotation and swap operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SddManager

        public SddManager(Vtree vtree)
        Creates a new SDD manager, given a vtree. The manager copies the input vtree. Any manipulations performed by the manager are done on its own copy, and does not affect the input vtree.
        Parameters:
        vtree -

      • SddManager

        public SddManager(long varCount,
                  boolean autoGcMin)
        Creates a new SDD manager using a balanced vtree over the given number of variables. Automatic garbage collection and automatic SDD minimization are activated in the created manager when autoGcMin is true
        Parameters:
        varCount -
        autoGcMin - automatic garbage collection and minimization

    • Method Detail

      • getPointer

        public jni.JNITYPE_p_sdd_manager_t getPointer()

      • copy

        public SddManager copy(Sdd[] nodes)
        Returns a new SDD manager, while copying the vtree and all the SDD nodes of this manager to it. After executing this method, the SDD nodes in the provided array will be replaced with the copies of those nodes in the new manager.
        Parameters:
        nodes - list of SDD nodes to copy
        Returns:
        copy of the SDD manager

      • free

        public void free()
        Frees the memory of an SDD manager created by new sdd manager, including all SDD nodes created using that manager.

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints various statistics that are collected by an SDD manager.

      • useAutoGcMin

        public void useAutoGcMin(boolean autoGcMin)
        Activates/Deactivates automatic garbage collection and automatic SDD minimization.
        Parameters:
        autoGcMin -

      • isAutoGcMinOn

        public boolean isAutoGcMinOn()
        Returns true if automatic garbage collection and automatic SDD minimization is activated, and returns false otherwise.

      • getOptions

        public java.lang.Object getOptions()
        Returns the options field
        Returns:
        options field

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.Object options)
        Sets the options field for an SDD manager. This field can be used to allocate auxiliary data to an SDD manager. The SDD library does not access this field directly
        Parameters:
        options -

      • isVarUsed

        public boolean isVarUsed(long var)
        Returns true if var is referenced by a decision SDD node (dead or alive); returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        var -
        Returns:
        true if var is referenced by a decision SDD node (dead or alive); false otherwise.

      • getVtreeOfVar

        public Vtree getVtreeOfVar(long var)
        Returns the leaf node of a manager’s vtree, which is associated with var.
        Parameters:
        var -
        Returns:
        the leaf node of a manager’s vtree, which is associated with var.

      • getLcaOfLiterals

        public Vtree getLcaOfLiterals(long[] literals)
        Returns the smallest vtree which contains the variables of literals, where count is the number of literals. If we view the variable of each literal as a leaf vtree node, the function will then return the lowest common ancestor (lca) of these leaf nodes.
        Parameters:
        literals -
        Returns:
        lca of literals

      • getVarCount

        public long getVarCount()
        Returns the number of SDD variables currently associated with the manager.
        Returns:
        the number of SDD variables currently associated with the manager.

      • getVarOrder

        public long[] getVarOrder()
        Returns:
        an array with the left-to-right variable ordering of the manager’s vtree.

      • addVarBeforeFirst

        public void addVarBeforeFirst()
        Add a new variable with index n + 1 to the manager, where n is the current number of variables in the manager. Let v be the leftmost leaf node in the vtree. A new leaf node labeled with variable n + 1 is created and made a left sibling of leaf v.

      • addVarAfterLast

        public void addVarAfterLast()
        Add a new variable with index n + 1 to the manager, where n is the current number of variables in the manager. Let v be the rightmost leaf node in the vtree. A new leaf node labeled with variable n + 1 is created and made a right sibling of leaf v.

      • addVarBefore

        public void addVarBefore(long targetVar)
        Add a new variable with index n + 1 to the manager, where n is the current number of variables in the manager. Let v be the vtree leaf node labeled with variable target var. A new leaf node labeled with variable n + 1 is created and made a left sibling of leaf v

      • addVarAfter

        public void addVarAfter(long targetVar)
        Add a new variable with index n + 1 to the manager, where n is the current number of variables in the manager. Let v be the vtree leaf node labeled with variable target var. A new leaf node labeled with variable n + 1 is created and made a right sibling of leaf v

      • addVarBeforeLca

        public void addVarBeforeLca(long[] lcaVars)
        Add a variable. The position in the Vtree of this new variable will be before the LCA (lowest common ancestor) of the given variables.
        Parameters:
        lcaVars - The variables that are used to find the position of the new variable.

      • moveVarBeforeFirst

        public void moveVarBeforeFirst(long var)
        Move the given variable before the first variable in the Vtree.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be moved.

      • moveVarAfterLast

        public void moveVarAfterLast(long var)
        Move the given variable after the last variable in the Vtree.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be moved.

      • moveVarBefore

        public void moveVarBefore(long var,
                          long targetVar)
        Move the given variable before the target variable in the Vtree.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be moved.
        targetVar - The target variable.

      • moveVarAfter

        public void moveVarAfter(long var,
                         long targetVar)
        Move the given variable after the target variable in the Vtree.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be moved.
        targetVar - The target variable.

      • moveVarBeforeLca

        public void moveVarBeforeLca(long var,
                             long[] lcaVars)
        Move the given variable before the LCA (least common ancestor) of the given variables in the Vtree.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be moved.
        lcaVars - The variables that are used to find the new position of the moved variable.

        public void removeLastAddedVar()
        Remove the variable that was last added to the manager.

      • saveSharedAsDot

        public void saveSharedAsDot(java.lang.String filename)
        Saves the SDD of the manager’s vtree (a shared SDD), formatted for use with Graphviz dot.
        Parameters:
        filename -

      • garbageCollect

        public void garbageCollect()
        Performs a global garbage collection: Claims all dead SDD nodes in the manager.

      • garbageCollect

        public void garbageCollect(Vtree vtree)
        Performs local garbage collection: Claims all dead SDD nodes inside or above vtree.
        Parameters:
        vtree -

      • garbageCollect

        public boolean garbageCollect(float deadNodeThreshold)
        Performs a global garbage collection if the number of dead SDD nodes over the number of all SDD nodes in the manager exceeds dead node threshold.
        Parameters:
        deadNodeThreshold -
        Returns:
        true if garbage collection is performed; false otherwise.

      • garbageCollect

        public boolean garbageCollect(float deadNodeThreshold,
                              Vtree vtree)
        Performs local garbage collection if the number of dead SDD nodes over the number of all SDD nodes in the vtree exceeds dead node threshold.
        Parameters:
        deadNodeThreshold -
        vtree -
        Returns:
        true if garbage collection is performed; false otherwise.

      • minimize

        public void minimize()
        Performs global garbage collection and then tries to minimize the size of manager’s SDD.

      • minimize

        public Vtree minimize(Vtree vtree)
        Performs local garbage collection on vtree and then tries to minimize the size of SDD of vtree by searching for a different vtree.
        Parameters:
        vtree -
        Returns:
        the root of found vtree.

      • minimizeLimited

        public void minimizeLimited()
        Performs global garbage collection and then tries to minimize the size of manager’s SDD.

      • minimizeLimited

        public Vtree minimizeLimited(Vtree vtree)
        Performs local garbage collection on vtree and then tries to minimize the size of SDD of vtree by searching for a different vtree.
        Parameters:
        vtree -
        Returns:
        the root of found vtree.

      • setConvergenceThreshold

        public void setConvergenceThreshold(float threshold)
        Sets the threshold for terminating the passes performed by the vtree search algorithm. Default value is 1.0, which means that search will terminate when a pass reduces the SDD size by less than 1.0%
        Parameters:
        threshold -

      • setVtreeSearchTimeLimit

        public void setVtreeSearchTimeLimit(float time_limit)
        Set the time limit for a vtree fragment in the vtree search algorithm. Time is in seconds and corresponds to CPU time. Default Value is 180 seconds.
        Parameters:
        time_limit -

      • setVtreeFragmentTimeLimit

        public void setVtreeFragmentTimeLimit(float time_limit)
        Set the time limit for a vtree fragment in the vtree search algorithm. Time is in seconds and corresponds to CPU time. Default Value is 60 seconds.
        Parameters:
        time_limit -

      • setVtreeOperationTimeLimit

        public void setVtreeOperationTimeLimit(float time_limit)
        Set the time limit for executing an operation (rotation or swap) in the vtree search algorithm. Time is in seconds and corresponds to CPU time. Default Value is 30 seconds.
        Parameters:
        time_limit -

      • setVtreeApplyTimeLimit

        public void setVtreeApplyTimeLimit(float time_limit)
        Set the time limit for executing an "apply" in the vtree search algorithm. Time is in seconds and corresponds to CPU time. Default Value is 10 seconds.
        Parameters:
        time_limit -

      • setVtreeOperationMemoryLimit

        public void setVtreeOperationMemoryLimit(float memory_limit)
        Sets the relative memory limit for rotation and swap operations. Default value is 3.0.
        Parameters:
        memory_limit -

      • setVtreeOperationSizeLimit

        public void setVtreeOperationSizeLimit(float size_limit)
        Sets the relative size limit for rotation and swap operations. Default value is 1.2. A size limit l is relative to the size s of an SDD for a given vtree (s is called the reference size). Hence, using this size limit requires calling the following functions to set and update the reference size s, otherwise the behavior is not defined.
        Parameters:
        size_limit -

      • setVtreeCartesianProductLimit

        public void setVtreeCartesianProductLimit(long size_limit)
        Sets the absolute size limit on the size of a cartesian product for right rotation and swap operations. Default value is 8,192
        Parameters:
        size_limit -

      • initVtreeSizeLimit

        public void initVtreeSizeLimit(Vtree vtree)
        Declares the size s of current SDD for vtree as the reference size for the relative size limit l. That is, a rotation or swap operation will fail if the SDD size grows to larger than s × l.
        Parameters:
        vtree -

      • updateVtreeSizeLimit

        public void updateVtreeSizeLimit()
        Updates the reference size for relative size limits. It is preferrable to invoke this function, as it is more efficent than the function sdd manager init vtree size limit as it does not directly recompute the size of vtree.

      • rotateLeft

        public boolean rotateLeft(Vtree vtree,
                          boolean limited)
        Rotates a vtree node left. This operation assumes no dead SDD nodes inside or above vtree. Moreover, this operation does not introduce any new dead SDD nodes
        Parameters:
        vtree - the vtree node to rotate
        limited - enforces Time and size limits, among others, if set to true
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeds and false otherwise (i.e., limits exceeded).

      • rotateRight

        public boolean rotateRight(Vtree vtree,
                           boolean limited)
        Rotates a vtree node right. This operation assumes no dead SDD nodes inside or above vtree. Moreover, this operation does not introduce any new dead SDD nodes
        Parameters:
        vtree - the vtree node to rotate
        limited - enforces Time and size limits, among others, if set to true
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeds and false otherwise (i.e., limits exceeded).

      • swap

        public boolean swap(Vtree vtree,
                    boolean limited)
        Swaps a vtree node. This operation assumes no dead SDD nodes inside or above vtree. Moreover, this operation does not introduce any new dead SDD nodes
        Parameters:
        vtree - the vtree node to swap
        limited - enforces Time and size limits, among others, if set to true
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeds and false otherwise (i.e., limits exceeded).
